name: Soupy Rendang
description: My families version of rendang. Beefy and creamy, perfect for a cold night in. Not at all authentic but delicious nonetheless
keywords: Rendang, Indonesian Cuisine, Beef Stew, Coconut Milk, Spices, Slow Cooker, Beef, Chuck, Lemongrass, Ginger, Garlic, Chili, Comfort Food

recipeInstructions.name: Prep Onions
recipeInstructions.text: Roughly dice onions. Heat oil in the large pot and soften onions. Add the coriander, cumin, turmeric, lemongrass, ginger and garlic and fry for about 1-2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.name: Brown Beef
recipeInstructions.text: Add beef and fry in the spice mix until sealed/browned.

recipeInstructions.name: Bring To Simmer
recipeInstructions.text: Dissolve beef stock in 1 Â½ cups of water. Add beef stock, coconut milk and desiccated coconut to the mix and bring to a slow boil.

recipeInstructions.name: Simmer
recipeInstructions.text: Simmer for about 4-5 hours. Over this time ensure the mix doesn't dry out.

recipeInstructions.name: Serving
recipeInstructions.text: Once the meat is tender and the sauce reaches the desired consistency, season to taste with salt and then it is ready!

notes: Not true to authentic rendang but this is how my family has made it for years.
Great with lime leaves as well. If adding, add them in before you simmer for 5h.
